clinical_study.brief_title: The Relationship Between Zonulin and Interleukin-8 Levels and Postoperative Delirium Development
clinical_study.official_title: The Relationship Between Zonulin and Interleukin-8 Levels and Postoperative Delirium Development in Patients Who Had Femur Fracture Surgery Under Regional Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: The relationship between zonulin and interleukin-8 levels and postoperative delirium development in patients who had femur fracture surgery under regional anesthesia

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients who are over 65 years of age and scheduled for femur fixation surgery will be included in the study. Blood samples for zonulin and interleukin-8 levels will be taken at the day prior to the surgery. All patients will be evaluated by Delirium Rating Scale (DRS) for delirium development at the postoperative 1., 2. and 3. days. Patients with a DRS score over 14 points will be included in the Group Delirium. And second blood samples for zonulin and interleukin-8 levels will be taken at the time of diagnosis.
Postoperative pain scores of the patients will recorded by using a numerical rating scale (NRS).

primary_outcome.description: The relation between postoperative delirium development and preoperative blood zonulin levels. The correlation between them will be analyzed by statistical analysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients over 65 years with mini mental state score > 21, undergoing femur fixation surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- anticholinergic drug use, known epilepsy, Parkinson, Alzheimer's disease, dementia, cognitive function disorder
